DOC.brief_summary: This study aimed to explore the influence of organic anion transporting polypeptide1B1 (OATP1B1) genotype on pharmacokinetics, lipid lowering effect and lipid profiles after rosuvastatin administration.
DOC.brief_title: Influence of Organic Anion Transporting Polypeptide1B1(OATP1B1) Genotype on Rosuvastatin PK, PD and Lipid Profiles
DOC.detailed_description: Open, one arm, single sequence study for healthy volunteers are investigated. Thirty four subjects may be enrolled. Rosuvastatin are administered once a day for 21 days. Before and after rosuvastatin administration, PK, PD and lipid profiles are investigated.
DOC.criteria: Age: Between 20 to 50 years of age, inclusive (age based on the date to give the informed consent) Weight: Over 55 kg, within Â±20% of ideal body weight Must be reliable and willing to make themselves available during the study period Must be willing to give blood sample for genotyping History of significant clinical illness needs medical caution, including cardiovascular, immunologic, hematologic, neuropsychiatric, respiratory, gastrointestinal, hepatic, or renal disease or other chronic disease History of a significant surgical resection of gastrointestinal tract except appendectomy History or evidence of drug abuse Use any medication during the last 14 days period before first dosing Hypersensitivity to HMGCoA reductase inhibitor Judged to be inappropriate for the study by the investigator
